= Test Fixtures from PeaZip

== Source

These test fixtures are from the PeaZip project.

* URL: https://peazip.github.io/

== Files Included

=== Encrypted Archives

* `encrypted/aes256.zip` - AES-256 encrypted ZIP
* `encrypted/twofish.7z` - Twofish encrypted 7z
* `encrypted/zcrypt.zip` - ZipCrypto encrypted
* `encrypted/password_protected.rar` - RAR with password

=== Multi-Format Tests

* `multi_format/various.zip` - ZIP format test
* `multi_format/various.7z` - 7z format test
* `multi_format/various.tar.gz` - TAR+GZ test
* `multi_format/various.tar.bz2` - TAR+BZ2 test

=== Special Cases

* `special_cases/long_filename.zip` - Long filename handling
* `special_cases/unicode_names.7z` - Unicode filenames
* `special_cases/nested_archives.zip` - Archives within archives
* `special_cases/empty_files.zip` - Empty file handling

== Usage in Omnizip

PeaZip test cases help verify Omnizip handles real-world archives
created by popular GUI archiving tools, including edge cases and
various encryption methods used in production environments.

== Modifications

None. These are standard test archives created with PeaZip or sourced
from the PeaZip test suite.
